overview:
Michael Durwin is a seasoned online creative marketer turned entrepreneur and founder of Rangl.Me.

Following stints at several Boston-area advertising agencies, Durwin embarked on the launch (pending) of Rangl.Me, a personal online profile management system. He began his career as a web designer in the early 90s, leveraging newsgroups and early social sites such as HotorNot.com as marketing tools, later called Social Media Marketing. Durwin attended Suffolk University’s New England School of Art & Design as a graphic design major. Recently he has begun a series of speaking engagements covering content creation, management, and corporate policies around social media and user experience.

Durwin was listed as an expert resource on Scalable Vector Graphics by the W3C and has accumulated awards for broadcast, direct mail, web design, packaging, and PR along the way.

Awards Bell Ringer Award for Decathlon Sports Silver Mark Award for HBO Latin America’s Capadocia Silver Mark Award for Comcast direct mail Mobile Development Challenge Award for Visit Florida Namic Multicultural Award for Comcast Video of the Day on AdAge.com for Decathlon Sportsâ€™ 2 Second Tent Top Ten Most Viewed Videos on AdAge.com for Decathlon Sports’ 2 Second Tent Adobe Site of the Week for New Balance 100 Years in 100 Seconds Regional Emmy for Manny Being Manny for Comcast Sports Network Golden Mirror Award of Merit from the Credit Union Executives Association for St Mary’s Credit Union

Clients: HBO, Microsoft, EMC, Reebok, J Jill, ABC, Vermont Teddy Bear, NBC, Hustler, Scripps Network, Decathlon Sports, Boston Bruins, Disney, ESPN, Univision, Nokia, Pitney Bowes, Liberty Mutual, Coca-Cola, Comcast.

Durwin joined Fuseideas as it’s second employee and as creative director helped grow it into an award-winning, $2.5 million agency in 2 years. Following this he worked as director of user experience at Boston Technologies, helping that company design a next-generation institutional FX trading platform and increase sales leads by 5000%, which helped push the company to #143 in the Inc500. He currently works as director of marketing at Exclusive Concepts (www.exclusiveconcepts.com).
